casebody.data:
Carlo DEMATO et al., Appellants, v. UNITED STATES, Appellee. No. 4767. Circuit Court of Appeals, Third Circuit. Aug. 20, 1932. James Mercer Davis, of Camden, N. J., for appellants. Phillip Forman, U. S. Atty., of Trenton, N. J., and John Grimshaw, Jr., Asst. U. S." Atty., of Paterson, N. J.

Before BUFFINGTON,' WOOLLEY", and THOMPSON, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

After argument and due consideration had, this case is reversed [see opinion, in Nunzio Scalo v. United States (C. C. A.) 60 F.(2d) 1086], and the record remanded at once so that an early trial may be had.
